data.chText: 重新获得，恢复（能力或品质等）
data.enText: to get back sth you no longer have, especially an ability or a quality

data.chText: 我努力恢复自己的一点儿尊严。
data.enText: I struggled to regain some dignity.

data.chText: 这一政党重新获得了这个地区的控制权。
data.enText: The party has regained control of the region.

data.chText: 她在边缘上暂停下来，努力恢复平衡。
data.enText: She paused on the edge, trying to regain her balance .

data.chText: 他好几天都没有恢复知觉。
data.enText: He did not regain consciousness (= wake up after being unconscious) for several days.
to get back to a place that you have left

data.chText: 他们最后终于回到了海滩。
data.enText: They finally managed to regain the beach.

means: 重新获得，恢复(能力或品质等)

ex.chText: 他心脏病发作了，正在康复之中。
ex.enText: He's recovering from a heart attack.

ex.chText: 服务业已恢复到战前水平。
ex.enText: The service industry has recovered to pre-war levels.

ex.chText: 她过了几天才恢复知觉。
ex.enText: It was days before she recovered consciousness.

synonyms.bx: 指人从疾病等中康复过来或某事物恢复常态，常后接介词 from；也指恢复能力、知觉等。

ex.chText: 在他的帮助之下，这个家族恢复了往昔的影响力。
ex.enText: Under his help, the family regained/recovered its former influence.

ex.chText: 敌人重新控制了火车站。
ex.enText: The enemies have regained control of the train station.

ex.chText: 在聚会上看到竞争对手令他很惊讶，但他很快就恢复了平静。
ex.enText: He was surprised to meet his rival at the party, but he soon regained/recovered his composure.

synonyms.bx: 尤指重新得到某物或恢复某状态，常可与 recover 换用。

ex.chText: 政府花了3年时间才使经济完全复苏。
ex.enText: It took the government three years to restore the economy to full strength.

ex.chText: 这些运动会帮助你完全康复。
ex.enText: These exercises will help you restore your full health.

ex.chText: 这两个国家一年前恢复了外交关系。
ex.enText: These two countries restored diplomatic relations with each other one year ago.

ex.chText: 旨在让公众对教育体制恢复信心的改革得到了评论家褒贬不一的评价。
ex.enText: Reforms aimed at restoring public confidence in the education system has had mixed reviews from the critics.

synonyms.bx: 指使某事物恢复到从前的状态，也指恢复某种乐观的情绪。

example: She found her voice and replied quickly

tr: find the location of something that was missed or lost

value.def: If you regain something that you have lost, you get it back again.

example.ex: Troops have regained control of the city...
It took him a while to regain his composure.
example.tran: 他过了一会儿才恢复镇定。

value.tran: 恢复；失而复得；重新得到

value.def: If you regain a place that you have left, you succeed in getting back there.

example.ex: Davis went to regain his carriage.
example.tran: 戴维斯回到他的马车上。
